title: The Many Paths on Immigration
body:
To the Editor:

  It's precisely because Americans are fed up because they have to ''press one for English'' that the Senate voted 
for English to be the national language.

 Previous generations of immigrants came to this country not knowing English, yet they learned our language and 
conformed to our customs -- not the other way around. 

  We always have been ''Out of many, one,'' and that includes our one and only language, English. 

  The melting pot worked. Why change now?

Carla Wallach

Greenwich, Conn., May 21, 2006
